bibdata.title: Populate the bibdata tables with the desired recap location names that are included in the issue.

comments.body: I'm not sure now if we want all the three files to be updated in the same way. In production for "rcppb" https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/main/marc_to_solr/translation_maps/location_display.rb.tmpl has ReCAP and https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/main/marc_to_solr/translation_maps/locations.rb.tmpl has "rcppb" => "ReCAP - Supervised use in Firestone ". So maybe we want to replicate what we have in production. @kevinreiss ?

example: From the Alma system we get for 'pb': "recap$pb"=>"ReCAP - rcppb RECAP Firestone Use" 

https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/0f1a5b453cc7bef6403f710fbec2013410d682bd/marc_to_solr/translation_maps/locations.rb.tmpl#L377 (can we configure in Alma system the names so that we get ReCAP - Supervised use in Firestone )
and https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/0f1a5b453cc7bef6403f710fbec2013410d682bd/marc_to_solr/translation_maps/location_display.rb.tmpl#L369 ReCAP. (same like production)

It seems that most of these changes were not from voyager and were done through the bibdata UI. 
per @kevinreiss these names were edited to be more patron friendly since most of the purpose of this was to configure blacklight.

So I will move forward to preserve these patron friendly names across the files.

After further review with @kevinreiss the file that needs to be maintained because it is not coming from the Alma system is the holding_library.rb https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/alma/marc_to_solr/translation_maps/holding_library.rb.tmpl

@kevinreiss and his team will take care of https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1178 file https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/alma/marc_to_solr/translation_maps/locations.rb.tmpl

bibdata.title: Rename 'Rare Books and Special Collections' to 'Special Collections'

comments.body:
Thank you for changing the name @regineheberlein.

Your questions make a lot of sense. @kevinreiss @mzelesky who is the right person/group of people to answer these questions?
I'll ask Alexis about the External Names
Thank you!

Per conversation with Alexis:
1. Change external name to human readable expanded string
2. Change internal name to code + abbreviated human readable string
3. remove all prefixes

I'll get started now.
Also pinged Joshua about the East Asian location labels (currently all "East Asian Rare")
@mzelesky @kevinreiss Can we delete the location "UNASSIGNED"?
@christinach What gets displayed in Blacklight, Name or External Name?

We cannot delete the location "UNASSIGNED"; it's used for migration purposes. At least, that's my understanding. If there is nothing in the locations after go-live we can delete. In general, we cannot delete any locations prior to go-live unless those locations are also deleted in Voyager.
@regineheberlein we use 'name', not the 'external_name'
@regineheberlein but we can change it to the 'external_name' if that makes more sense.

@christinach Yes please. There is a difference between what staff need to see in the UI and what we want patrons to see in Blacklight, so changing the source to external_name for Blacklight would be great.
@regineheberlein I will! Thank you.
@christinach Thank you! I'm making a new ticket for it now.
Now reaching out to Martin per Joshua
Martin confirms that the labels for EA rare, while all the same, are good as is.

comments.body:
> AbsoluteIdsController#create_batch takes a LONG time. 18 seconds for a test where all the responses are mocked.

I was finding this as well. I can create an issue for this.

> We're querying for an entire tree and all its top containers, resulting in something like 2N calls, where N is the number of components. I don't think this will scale.

I have just found an alternative when working through #76 which should resolve this. I will create an issue for this also.

lib_jobs.title: Identify bottlenecks and address performance improvements for AJAX requests to generate new AbsoluteID models

comments.body:
One area where performance is restricted lies within the creation of `AbsoluteId` Models, where `TopContainers` need to be converted from `LibJobs::ArchivesSpace::TopContainer` to `AbsoluteId::TopContainer` instances. This is currently using `AbsoluteId::TopContainer#find`.

Perhaps just serializing the `AbsoluteId::TopContainer` as JSON will prove effective.

lib_jobs.title: Improve the resolution between TopContainers and ArchivesSpace Resources for AbsoluteIDs

comments.body: https://archivesspace.github.io/archivesspace/api/#search-for-top-containers shows promise for me, as it should provide one with the ability to identify the collections in which it belongs.

`curl -v -H "X-ArchivesSpace-Session: $SESSION" "https://aspace-staging.princeton.edu/staff/api/repositories/4/top_containers/search?q=Box"` nearly leads to a time out for my local development environment, only to eventually lead to the following: ```bash

Problem accessing /repositories/4/top_containers/search. Reason: 

    Java heap space

Caused by:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at org.jruby.util.ByteList.ensure(ByteList.java:345)
	at org.jruby.util.io.EncodingUtils.strBufCat(EncodingUtils.java:1712)
	at org.jruby.util.io.EncodingUtils.strBufCat(EncodingUtils.java:1697)
	at org.jruby.util.io.EncodingUtils.encCrStrBufCat(EncodingUtils.java:1820)
	at org.jruby.util.io.EncodingUtils.encCrStrBufCat(EncodingUtils.java:1747)
	at org.jruby.RubyString.cat19(RubyString.java:1372)
	at org.jruby.RubyString.cat19(RubyString.java:1362)
	at org.jruby.RubyString.append19(RubyString.java:2656)
	at org.jruby.RubyString.concatSingle(RubyString.java:2666)
	at org.jruby.RubyString$INVOKER$i$1$0$concatSingle.call(RubyString$INVOKER$i$1$0$concatSingle.gen)
	at org.jruby.runtime.callsite.CachingCallSite.call(CachingCallSite.java:172)
	at uri_3a_classloader_3a_.META_minus_INF.jruby_dot_home.lib.ruby.stdlib.net.protocol.invokeOther19:\=\^\^(uri:classloader:/META-INF/jruby.home/lib/ruby/stdlib/net/protocol.rb:129)
	at uri_3a_classloader_3a_.META_minus_INF.jruby_dot_home.lib.ruby.stdlib.net.protocol.RUBY$method$read$0(uri:classloader:/META-INF/jruby.home/lib/ruby/stdlib/net/protocol.rb:129)
	at java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$DMH/1738290946.invokeStatic_L7_L(LambdaForm$DMH)
	at java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$MH/621432843.invokeExact_MT(LambdaForm$MH)
	at org.jruby.internal.runtime.methods.CompiledIRMethod.call(CompiledIRMethod.java:82)
	at org.jruby.internal.runtime.methods.CompiledIRMethod.call(CompiledIRMethod.java:118)
	at org.jruby.internal.runtime.methods.MixedModeIRMethod.call(MixedModeIRMethod.java:175)
	at org.jruby.internal.runtime.methods.DynamicMethod.call(DynamicMethod.java:208)
	at org.jruby.runtime.callsite.CachingCallSite.call(CachingCallSite.java:203)
	at org.jruby.ir.interpreter.InterpreterEngine.processCall(InterpreterEngine.java:325)
	at org.jruby.ir.interpreter.StartupInterpreterEngine.interpret(StartupInterpreterEngine.java:72)
	at org.jruby.ir.interpreter.InterpreterEngine.interpret(InterpreterEngine.java:92)
	at org.jruby.internal.runtime.methods.MixedModeIRMethod.INTERPRET_METHOD(MixedModeIRMethod.java:191)
	at org.jruby.internal.runtime.methods.MixedModeIRMethod.call(MixedModeIRMethod.java:178)
	at org.jruby.internal.runtime.methods.DynamicMethod.call(DynamicMethod.java:208)
	at org.jruby.runtime.callsite.CachingCallSite.call(CachingCallSite.java:203)
	at org.jruby.ir.interpreter.InterpreterEngine.processCall(InterpreterEngine.java:325)
	at org.jruby.ir.interpreter.StartupInterpreterEngine.interpret(StartupInterpreterEngine.java:72)
	at org.jruby.ir.interpreter.Interpreter.INTERPRET_BLOCK(Interpreter.java:116)
	at org.jruby.runtime.MixedModeIRBlockBody.commonYieldPath(MixedModeIRBlockBody.java:136)
	at org.jruby.runtime.IRBlockBody.doYield(IRBlockBody.java:166)
Powered by Jetty://
``` So perhaps it was premature to assume that https://archivesspace.github.io/archivesspace/api/#search-for-top-containers is a potential solution.

Even just attempting `curl -v -H "X-ArchivesSpace-Session: $SESSION" "https://aspace-staging.princeton.edu/staff/api/repositories/4/top_containers/search?q=Box&root_record=ABID001&fields[]=id"` still leads to issues for the Solr index: ```bash

HTTP ERROR 500

Problem accessing /repositories/4/top_containers/search. Reason: 

    Java heap space

Caused by:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
Powered by Jetty://
```

`curl -v -H "X-ArchivesSpace-Session: $SESSION" "https://aspace-staging.princeton.edu/staff/api/repositories/4/search?q=ABID001&page=1&type[]=top_container"` is not timing out, and I seem to be able to resolve the `TopContainer` REST resources fairly readily.
